meta.name: NASRDA Navigation Design System
meta.description: High-level creative direction and design tokens inspired by the NASRDA (National Space Research and Development Agency) brand identity for use across the NasrdaNavi app.
meta.designIntent: Evocative, cinematic navigation UI that combines space exploration themes with premium digital cartography, reflecting NASRDA's mission of space research and development.

colorPalette.description: Deep space blue base inspired by NASRDA logo with vibrant orange/yellow rocket flame accents, Nigerian green, and gold highlights. Dark cosmic background with bright accent markers.

typography.description: Contrast between elegant serif for headings and clean geometric sans-serif for UI chrome. Large, spaced headings; small, compact body and labels.

serifDisplay.usage: Major headings, category titles, large section labels.

sansBody.usage: Body copy, navigation items, metrics, controls, cards.

monoNumeric.usage: Distances, coordinates, numeric labels if needed.

spacing.description: Tight micro-spacing for dense map controls; generous negative space surrounding major headings and primary map content.

radii.description: Mostly sharp with subtle rounding on interactive surfaces and map markers.

shadows.description: Soft, feathered glows that pull panels above a dark map without looking skeuomorphic.

borders.description: Subtle hairlines and inner strokes to separate panels from the map.

layout.description: Full-bleed map canvas with a strong left sidebar column, a minimal top navigation strip, and a right-side vertical control cluster. Everything floats above a textured, space-blue toned map evoking cosmic navigation.

topNav.notes: Nav items are small caps serif or sans, spaced out with wide tracking. Links are white with a subtle glow on hover; underline or dot indicator is understated.

leftSidebar.notes: Acts as the navigation mode switcher and section title area. Uses vertical writing or rotated labels for section categories (Buildings, Roads, POIs, etc.).

mapCanvas.notes: Map imagery is always visible; UI elements float above. Use additive blend modes where possible to keep map details visible under overlays.

rightControls.notes: Vertical stack with circular location button and rectangular zoom buttons. Keep the stack compact to maintain visual hierarchy with the main cards.

bottomInfoRail.notes: Contains weather/time on left, POI carousel along center, and a primary info card anchored to bottom-right.

alignmentPrinciples: Anchor major structures (sidebar, bottom rail, right control stack) to the viewport edges, not to each other.
Line up center points of markers and route lines with the corresponding card or list item where possible.
Use consistent vertical gaps between stacked elements (8–12px for micro controls, 24–32px for major sections).
Keep typography mostly left-aligned; only numeric or metric data may be right-aligned for emphasis.

brandBar.description: Top-left brand lockup containing NASRDA circular logo and agency name.
structure: Circular NASRDA logo with space blue background, rocket, stars, diamond, and Nigerian Coat of Arms
Agency name in stacked format: 'NASRDA' bold serif above 'National Space Research and Development Agency' small caps sans, or full name in single line

topNavigation.description: Minimal top navigation with evenly spaced section links.

sidebarSectionSwitcher.description: Left column with vertical category labels such as ATMs, Bus Stops, Cafés etc.

mapRoutePath.description: Highlighted route line connecting POI markers on the map.

behavior.hover: Optionally increase glow opacity and width by +1px.
behavior.animation: Subtle pulsing glow along the path when route is actively being followed.

mapMarkerPrimary.description: Primary circular marker used at endpoints and selected POIs.
mapMarkerPrimary.shape: circle with small pointer nub or subtle shadow to indicate elevation

mapMarkerSecondary.description: Secondary small markers for other POIs in the same category.

mapControlsVertical.description: Right-side vertical cluster with location button and zoom controls.

poiCarouselChip.description: Small circular chips along the bottom rail representing nearby cafés.

layout.stack: icon photography or category glyph inside with numeric badge

poiPrimaryDetailCard.description: Large right-bottom card showing photo, name, address and contact details for the selected POI.

sections: Media thumbnail on left or top-left

primaryButton.description: Dominant CTA button used for actions like 'Get More Information'.

weatherWidget.description: Compact weather and time display in bottom-left.

scrollDotsVertical.description: Slim vertical sequence of small dots on the right representing scroll position or sections.

principles: Map first: the cartographic layer is always visible and should never be completely covered by flat, opaque panels.
Contrast via color temperature: use warm orange/yellow rocket flame accents and Nigerian green against deep space blue backgrounds and cool whites for text, creating a cosmic navigation aesthetic.
Density with clarity: support many UI elements simultaneously, but keep them grouped and aligned so cognitive load remains low.
Minimal chrome: borders and panel edges are subtle; rely on light, shadow, and gradients to define hierarchy.
Typography as identity: large, elegant serif headings differentiate the experience from generic map apps.
Focus through glow: use soft glows (rocket flame orange, space blue) and accent strokes to indicate primary routes and active markers, evoking the luminosity of stars and rocket propulsion.
Edge anchoring: major UI elements are locked to viewport edges, giving the central map room to breathe.
Avoid clutter: avoid unnecessary lines, icons, or decorations; every visible mark should communicate state or context.
do: Use accentPrimary (rocket flame orange) for routes, key markers, and the most important action only, evoking the propulsion theme from the NASRDA logo.
Keep backgrounds dark space blue and textured; preserve subtle map details under overlays, creating a cosmic navigation experience.
Maintain consistent spacing increments from the spacing scale for all margins, gaps, and padding.
Use uppercased small labels for categories and meta information.
Introduce subtle motion (fades, slight slides, low-amplitude pulsing glows) rather than large, bouncy animations.
dont: Do not introduce bright saturated colors outside the defined accent palette.
Do not use heavy drop shadows with hard edges; shadows should be soft and atmospheric.
Do not center large blocks of body text; reserve centering for singular metrics or icons.
Do not round all corners heavily; rounding should be reserved for markers, chips, and buttons.
Do not flatten the UI fully; some depth is required to float panels above the map.
